text: Joseph A. Hardy III (January 7, 1923 â€“ January 7, 2023) was an American businessman. He was the founder and CEO of 84 Lumber and Nemacolin Woodlands Resort. In 1992, after 34 years of running the company, Hardy retired. In 2007, he unsuccessfully ran for commissioner of Fayette County, Pennsylvania. Hardy died on his 100th birthday on January 7, 2023. ==References== Category:1923 births Category:2023 deaths Category:American centenarians Category:American philanthropists Category:Businesspeople from Pennsylvania Category:Politicians from Pennsylvania
title: Joseph A. Hardy III
